pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor config 2

content.raw:
I can’t seem to add you with just your name.  I need your username and/or email address to give you permission.  Let me know what to do there.

For the point lasers, we preferably wanted to model the Terabee One rangefinders which have a range of 14 meters and I don’t know the update rate offhand.  I think 10 Hz, which would work just fine for us in the simulator as well.  We can make those changes, no problem.  

The only reason we chose to have 2 laser beams instead of 1 was because we took the 2D-lidar model from subt simulator and just reduced it down to 1 point, but this didn’t display well in rviz, so we changed it to 2, and that seemed to make rviz happy.  We only need one point.  I’m not sure where your lidarlite sensor model lives, but that would be fine as well.
content.html:
I can’t seem to add you with just your name. I need your username and/or email address to give you permission. Let me know what to do there.

For the point lasers, we preferably wanted to model the Terabee One rangefinders which have a range of 14 meters and I don’t know the update rate offhand. I think 10 Hz, which would work just fine for us in the simulator as well. We can make those changes, no problem.

The only reason we chose to have 2 laser beams instead of 1 was because we took the 2D-lidar model from subt simulator and just reduced it down to 1 point, but this didn’t display well in rviz, so we changed it to 2, and that seemed to make rviz happy. We only need one point. I’m not sure where your lidarlite sensor model lives, but that would be fine as well.
